intro: Erysimum radicatum, commonly known as the rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has basal leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape, often with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Erysimum radicatum is often found in open habitats such as slopes, meadows, and along stream banks.
